|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | A talisman charged with arcane forces of unknown provenance, to be worn as jewellery on a finger.***"A ring of gold and a milk-white dove Are goodly gifts for thee, And a hempen rope for your own love To hang upon a tree."-Oscar Wilde, "Chanson". 1881. |

A **ring** is a type of [jewellery](/Jewellery "Jewellery"). Characters may wear one ring on each hand, paw, or tentacle; this usually limits you to two rings at a time, but [octopodes](/Octopode "Octopode") may wear eight, and followers of [Ru](/Ru "Ru") who have sacrificed their hand can only wear one ring. The [artefact](/Artefact "Artefact") [macabre finger necklace](/Macabre_finger_necklace "Macabre finger necklace") grants one additional ring slot. Despite their additional limbs, [formicids](/Formicid "Formicid") are still limited to two ring slots.

Rings have the advantage of only requiring 0.5 [auts](/Aut "Aut") to remove or put on (1 turn to swap entirely), letting characters change their resistances on the fly.

There are 18 different base types of rings; [random artefact](/Randart "Randart") rings each use one type of base ring when generated, but will have one or more additional properties. For a list of preset artefect rings, see [List of unrands](/List_of_unrands#Rings "List of unrands"):

## List of rings

- [![Ring of dexterity.png](/images/0/08/Ring_of_dexterity.png)](/File:Ring_of_dexterity.png) **+6 [Ring of dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity")**: Increases the player's [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") by 6.
- [![Ring of evasion.png](/images/8/87/Ring_of_evasion.png)](/File:Ring_of_evasion.png) **+4 [Ring of evasion](/Ring_of_evasion "Ring of evasion")**: Increases the player's [EV](/EV "EV") score by 4.
- [![Ring of fire.png](/images/b/bd/Ring_of_fire.png)](/File:Ring_of_fire.png) **[Ring of fire](/Ring_of_fire "Ring of fire")**: Grants rF+, rC-, and one [spellpower](/Spellpower "Spellpower") boost to [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic").
- [![Ring of flight.png](/images/1/1e/Ring_of_flight.png)](/File:Ring_of_flight.png) **[Ring of flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight")**: Grants [Flight](/Flight "Flight").
- [![Ring of ice.png](/images/f/f8/Ring_of_ice.png)](/File:Ring_of_ice.png) **[Ring of ice](/Ring_of_ice "Ring of ice")**: Grants rC+, rF-, and one [spellpower](/Spellpower "Spellpower") boost to [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic").
- [![Ring of intelligence.png](/images/3/3b/Ring_of_intelligence.png)](/File:Ring_of_intelligence.png) **+6 [Ring of intelligence](/Ring_of_intelligence "Ring of intelligence")**: Increases the player's [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") by 6.
- [![Ring of magical power.png](/images/6/6e/Ring_of_magical_power.png)](/File:Ring_of_magical_power.png) **[Ring of magical power](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power")**: Increases the player's maximum [MP](/MP "MP") by 9, removes 9 MP when taking off.
- [![Ring of poison resistance.png](/images/8/84/Ring_of_poison_resistance.png)](/File:Ring_of_poison_resistance.png) **[Ring of poison resistance](/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance")**: Grants [rPois](/Poison#Poison_Resistance "Poison").
- [![Ring of positive energy.png](/images/f/fb/Ring_of_positive_energy.png)](/File:Ring_of_positive_energy.png) **[Ring of positive energy](/Ring_of_positive_energy "Ring of positive energy")**: Grants [rN+](/Negative_Energy#Negative_Energy_Resistance "Negative Energy").
- [![Ring of protection.png](/images/b/bb/Ring_of_protection.png)](/File:Ring_of_protection.png) **+4 [Ring of protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection")**: Increases the player's [AC](/AC "AC") score by 4.
- [![Ring of protection from cold.png](/images/1/13/Ring_of_protection_from_cold.png)](/File:Ring_of_protection_from_cold.png) **[Ring of protection from cold](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold")**: Grants [rC+](/Cold#Cold_Resistance "Cold").
- [![Ring of protection from fire.png](/images/2/2d/Ring_of_protection_from_fire.png)](/File:Ring_of_protection_from_fire.png) **[Ring of protection from fire](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire")**: Grants [rF+](/Fire#Fire_Resistance "Fire").
- [![Ring of resist corrosion.png](/images/5/56/Ring_of_resist_corrosion.png)](/File:Ring_of_resist_corrosion.png) **[Ring of resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion")**: Grants [rCorr](/Acid#Corrosion_Resistance "Acid").
- [![Ring of see invisible.png](/images/b/b3/Ring_of_see_invisible.png)](/File:Ring_of_see_invisible.png) **[Ring of see invisible](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible")**: Grants the [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible") intrinsic.
- [![Ring of slaying.png](/images/b/b4/Ring_of_slaying.png)](/File:Ring_of_slaying.png) **+4 [Ring of slaying](/Ring_of_slaying "Ring of slaying")**: Increases the player's [slaying](/Slaying "Slaying") by 4 (equivalent to weapon enchantment).
- [![Ring of strength.png](/images/4/40/Ring_of_strength.png)](/File:Ring_of_strength.png) **+6 [Ring of strength](/Ring_of_strength "Ring of strength")**: Increases the player's [strength](/Strength "Strength") by 6.
- [![Ring of willpower.png](/images/4/41/Ring_of_willpower.png)](/File:Ring_of_willpower.png) **[Ring of willpower](/Ring_of_willpower "Ring of willpower")**: Increases the player's [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") by 40.
- [![Ring of wizardry.png](/images/4/4c/Ring_of_wizardry.png)](/File:Ring_of_wizardry.png) **[Ring of wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry")**: Increases spell success rate for all spells.

## Obsolete Rings

- **[Ring of attention](/Ring_of_attention "Ring of attention")**: removed in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").
- **[Ring of stealth](/Ring_of_stealth "Ring of stealth")**: removed in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").
- **[Ring of teleportation](/Ring_of_teleportation "Ring of teleportation")**: removed in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").
- **[Ring of sustain attributes](/Ring_of_sustain_attributes "Ring of sustain attributes")**: removed in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").
- **[Ring of invisibility](/Ring_of_invisibility "Ring of invisibility")**: removed in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18").
- **[Ring of teleport control](/Ring_of_teleport_control "Ring of teleport control")**: removed in [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").
- **[Ring of regeneration](/Ring_of_regeneration "Ring of regeneration")**: replaced with [amulet of regeneration](/Amulet_of_regeneration "Amulet of regeneration") in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16").
- **[Ring of hunger](/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger")**: removed in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15").
- **[Ring of sustenance](/Ring_of_sustenance "Ring of sustenance")**: removed in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15").
- **[Ring of levitation](/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation")**: replaced with [rings of flight](/Rings_of_flight "Rings of flight") in [0.12](/0.12 "0.12").

Ring

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
A talisman charged with arcane forces of unknown provenance, to be worn as jewellery on a finger.

"A ring of gold and a milk-white dove
Are goodly gifts for thee,
And a hempen rope for your own love
To hang upon a tree."

-Oscar Wilde, "Chanson". 1881.

A ring is a type of jewellery. Characters may wear one ring on each hand, paw, or tentacle; this usually limits you to two rings at a time, but octopodes may wear eight, and followers of Ru who have sacrificed their hand can only wear one ring. The artefact macabre finger necklace grants one additional ring slot. Despite their additional limbs, formicids are still limited to two ring slots.

Rings have the advantage of only requiring 0.5 auts to remove or put on (1 turn to swap entirely), letting characters change their resistances on the fly.

There are 18 different base types of rings; random artefact rings each use one type of base ring when generated, but will have one or more additional properties. For a list of preset artefect rings, see List of unrands:

List of rings

  • +6 Ring of dexterity: Increases the player's dexterity by 6.
  • +4 Ring of evasion: Increases the player's EV score by 4.
  • Ring of fire: Grants rF+, rC-, and one spellpower boost to Fire Magic.
  • Ring of flight: Grants Flight.
  • Ring of ice: Grants rC+, rF-, and one spellpower boost to Ice Magic.
  • +6 Ring of intelligence: Increases the player's intelligence by 6.
  • Ring of magical power: Increases the player's maximum MP by 9, removes 9 MP when taking off.
  • Ring of poison resistance: Grants rPois.
  • Ring of positive energy: Grants rN+.
  • +4 Ring of protection: Increases the player's AC score by 4.
  • Ring of protection from cold: Grants rC+.
  • Ring of protection from fire: Grants rF+.
  • Ring of resist corrosion: Grants rCorr.
  • Ring of see invisible: Grants the see invisible intrinsic.
  • +4 Ring of slaying: Increases the player's slaying by 4 (equivalent to weapon enchantment).
  • +6 Ring of strength: Increases the player's strength by 6.
  • Ring of willpower: Increases the player's willpower by 40.
  • Ring of wizardry: Increases spell success rate for all spells.

Obsolete Rings

  • Ring of attention: removed in 0.27.
  • Ring of stealth: removed in 0.27.
  • Ring of teleportation: removed in 0.27.
  • Ring of sustain attributes: removed in 0.19.
  • Ring of invisibility: removed in 0.18.
  • Ring of teleport control: removed in 0.17.
  • Ring of regeneration: replaced with amulet of regeneration in 0.16.
  • Ring of hunger: removed in 0.15.
  • Ring of sustenance: removed in 0.15.
  • Ring of levitation: replaced with rings of flight in 0.12.
